text: The Baja California coast, Mexico, day. The camera pans slowly to the right.

title: PROBABLY
text: We are now entering Ensenada, the second largest city on the Mexican Baja Peninsula. We have now traveled over 2000 miles since leaving New York City. We'll just be stopping here for a few moments for gas, and then our tour will continue on to its final destination.

title: PROBABLY
text: Cartman's house, later. Cartman, Stan, and Kyle enter. Dialog from "Not Without My Anus," set to an organ and canned laughter, is heard as the boys make their way across a living room littered with toys of all sorts. The room is decorated so that the boys would forget their "mission" and just play for one afternoon. Liane shows up with a Cartman favorite.

text: Hello, kiddies. I made you all powdered dougnut pancake surprise.

text: You want to rule more than hell? You want to destroy the earth?

text: No, it's kind of a long story but, well, it all started when this Iraqi dictator, Saddam Hussein , was killed by a pack of wild boars. I remember when I first met him in hell. It was a lovely morning in April...

title: PROBABLY
text: Cartman's church, day. Cartman leads the kids in singing and rolls on his back a few times.

text: Halleluyah! Praise the Lord! And now, I'm receiving a message directly from God-uh! God is telling me that... each and every one of you is to walk up to the stage, and give me one dollar! text: Dude, that seems- kind of- weird.

text: Heaven, a separate area. Satan finishes his story

title: PROBABLY
text: Heh-and now Chris and Saddam just keep killing each other over and over and... I don't know which one to pick.

text: Jesus, what the hell happened to you?

text: Huh?

text: You got kicked out of here for being a headstrong rebel. And now you're a whiny little bitch.

title: PROBABLY
text: No, you've become dependent on relationships. So you haven't even considered the option of not being with either of them. You need to spend time alone so that you can find the balance, the middle ground. That's what I always do, because I'm a Buddhist.

title: PROBABLY
text: God, you're right. You know, I've had steady relationships for the last... thousand years, and when one ends I just start another one, but... I haven't taken the time to be secure with myself.

text: Bingo.

text: Hey- Thanks, God. I forgot how clear you make things sometimes.

text: Cartman's church, day. The singing and clapping have resumed. Stan and Kyle go through some curtains to the back of the church.

text: Yeess.  Yeess.  It worked, you guys, it actually worked!

text: Of course, you guys! And then we can make... ten million dollars!  Look, the tooth fairy thing didn't work, the boy band thing didn't last, so I tried this route.

text: Dude, if God is all-understanding, he wouldn't send us to hell. Even Sister Anne told me that.
